tweets.text:
Heavy rain brings a high risk of surface water #flooding. 

Stay safe and don‚Äôt walk or drive through flood water. 

For guidance on #SurfaceWaterFlooding in your area, contact your local authority. 

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/8eYE9vH9AD

1/2 High levels on the River #Ouse and rain forecast this week will delay our work to replace the gate on the #Foss Barrier in #York. As soon as levels fall then we will be able to continue. Ensuring that flood protection on the River Foss is maintained is our top priority. https://t.co/zAlcy4yGXE

urls.title: Our Future Landscapes: making the most of our moorland (virtual workshop)
urls.description: A free online participative workshop to explore how we can work together to make the most of our fantastic moorland environment.

tweets.text:
Find out more and get involved in Kirklees Future Landscapes Strategy ‚Äì Thursday 21st January 7 pm.

Book your place here: https://t.co/6raISlDOQR

I have been keeping in touch with @EnvAgencyYNE today. We are expecting heavy rain falls on saturated ground and snow melt. Preparations are being made, however as the week progresses there will be clearer understanding the impact that this will have. Please check #VikingRecorder https://t.co/EJbpmQULZ6

Monksleaze was closed early this morning, the Sowy has returned to its normal winter level. We will be allowing the KSD level to fall substantially overnight to allow for some new flow monitoring equipment to be installed before the next band of rain comes in. #KSD  @EnvAgencySW

Heavy rainfall associated with Storm Christoph will be affecting North Wales and Shropshire over the next few days. This may result in Flood Alerts and Warnings being issued by @EnvAgencyMids . Keep an eye on the Environment Agency website: https://t.co/qme3ouRPBp

The Joint Unit for Waste Crime is a year old. What has it achieved?

The JUWC joined other agencies on a raid in Kent. Seven people held on suspicion of various offences. 

Police found stolen vehicles, a loaded shotgun and other weapons. MORE: https://t.co/U7sHyVCF47

WATCH ‚¨áÔ∏è https://t.co/zK60aGZRwv

There is potential for flooding over the next few days.  #Lichfield (#Fradley) hosts the @EnvAgency in the Midlands.
So keep an eye out for @EnvAgencyMids tweets for the latest news.
https://t.co/5QoWbgi7zA

tweets.text: Ahead of heavy rainfall expected on Tuesday and Wednesday due to Storm Christoph, JBA's @floodforesight is forecasting the potential for flooding across northern England, coinciding with @metoffice and @EnvAgency warnings. We'll continue to monitor the event as it unfolds. https://t.co/5poKvPBnKZ

The @metofficeYorks have issued an Amber warning for heavy rain üåßÔ∏è in West Yorkshire. 

#BePrepared - Help and advice to protect your property from flooding at https://t.co/rUEwVe6Kqo 

üí™We have teams ready to respond.

Follow @EnvAgencyYNE @metofficeYorks

#WakeyWinter https://t.co/krXZjQ3qKC

We are preparing our water rescue equipment today. You should be preparing your flood plans. Keep up to date with current advice from the @EnvAgencyYNE and @metoffice Another thing just to say, Don‚Äôt drive through floodwater. @NorthYorksFire https://t.co/k52H5JKxE5

The @EnvAgency investigated the "HS2 pollution incident" at Shardeloes Lake back in May 2020 and saw nothing. No example of being the most "environmentally responsible major infrastructure project in UK history". More let's hide the problems until full environmental approval. https://t.co/eDRZWPzzPL

@EnvAgencySE @EnvAgency The details are all in posts I have made in the past few days. The site speaks for itself. Rather than ring you, and sit on hold, and then go through it all again, please simply read up, then address this issue with a site visit and a clean-up. Thanks.

urls.title: Successful first year for waste crime taskforce despite pandemic
urls.description: The Joint Unit for Waste Crime celebrates its first anniversary of cracking down on criminals and gangs who commit serious and organised waste crime.

tweets.text:
#WasteCrime harms our environment, community and economy.
 
We joined forces with partners to form the Joint Unit for Waste Crime, to share intelligence and work in innovative ways to disrupt waste criminals. 
 
Here's what we've achieved after 1 year üëá
https://t.co/sYwoOeE6Xu https://t.co/dKen8cb5Py

tweets.text:
We are already making preparations ahead of the heavy #rain due this week. 

Team are out across the North West making sure rivers are running clear and free from debris. 

Sign up now to receive free flood alerts and warnings ‚ñ∂Ô∏è  https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn https://t.co/oAgHMr9KrN

urls.title: How to prepare for flooding
urls.description: Find out what you can do to prepare¬†for a flood.

tweets.text: With Storm Christoph likely to cause heavy rainfall early tomorrow, we may see some flood alerts in place across Leeds. Here‚Äôs a useful guide from @EnvAgencyYNE showing what each flood alert means. More info at https://t.co/qxopW25Dr5 #PrepareActSurvive #Leeds https://t.co/6bd9UoAGXC

Thank you @CRTSouthEast for committing to remove the rubbish  from the reservoir üëè More than unsightly, litter is harmful to the wildlife that make this an SSSI. Thanks also to @EnvAgencySE for committing to clean the traps üëè Please could you both update us on timings? https://t.co/PM9RmiBzDH

@CRTContactUs @DobbyWoods Have you referred this matter to @EnvAgencySE ?
